review_title: Your Experience depends on Your Team Leader
pros: HR department has some good staff and an efficient hiring process. A company that desires to grow out of its SME image (but still SME -vibe end of the day). Company results are stable.
cons: HR business partner who is supposed to oversee the L&D and well-being of employee is not personal. I didn't even know who she is until the day of the exit interview. A lot of corporate talk but makes zero effort to form connection. Team leader is bias towards her favorite team members, doesn't listen to suggestions, forces unnecessary frequent and long meetings with subjects that she is only interested in while most of us prefer to get on with work. It was a waste of time, but the company has a submissive culture where people don't speak up or want to rock any boat. Lacking in cross function interaction if you're a junior staff. Work is silo within your department. Pantry is basic with sachets milos, and 3-in-1 coffee packets. Have a small gym with minimum equipment. Nothing fancy. Like I'd said earlier, trying to get out of SME image but not quite there.

review_title: Flawed decision by management to cut cost potentially leading to long term issues
pros: Board of directors are kind to still give us bonus despite difficult times.
cons:
Random retrenchment few years ago across all department have created lopsided work load across various department. Some department constantly have to OT (some daily without fail at least for many team) and some are too free to question everything little things.

Worst decision ever by mgmt to outsource IT to an unproven company PCCW. Most companies outsourced operation, but we outsourced implementation as well. Until now PCCW have failed many major projects and going to fail more. CIO has repeated the same things every time that they are looking into the matters. Nothing change for more than 1 year. Most caliber IS folks transferring from SH to PCCW already left PCCW, leaving most subpar ex-SH IS personnel and many newbies who do not know much about the system and setup. Best is requestors are always blame for delaying the project.

review_title: Not a bad company to work with.
pros: Good allowances and benefits to employee
cons: No progression in career and slow increment

pros: HR is proactive in engaging employees. Example, provide channel for ask to get help to ensure a our mental health is taken care of, let employees be vaccinated early and etc. However these are no sufficient to stop the high turn-over rate in Consumer Business Group.
cons:
No leadership, management likes to hire FT who doesn't understand the Singapore market and culture. These FT can speak very well but they can't work and like to taichi their work to someone else. 

IT systems are old and every single day there are issues. Billing errors are a norm. And because systems are lousy, operations are very heavy and most of the time require manual work. 

Teams here have no cohesiveness. Everyone work based on their best interest with different goals in mind. People are scare of responsibility hence even if they see something wrong, they will not voice out and will pretend they do not know. When things go wrong, everyone start pointing fingers at each other and the first thing in mind is "who's fault is this" instead of "how to resolve this".

The Chief makes decisions based on his mood. When he is happy, everything gets approved and when he is not, be prepare to get scolded for the smallest thing. He can get petty, childish and personal when he woke up from the wrong side of the bed.

There are so many more issues with the working culture here...

review_title: A good place to work if you like a toxic environment :)
pros:
1) Had the opportunity to work with a micro-managing manager who is a perfectionist without empathy, and even resorted to personal attacks (eg. labelled as self-centered when choosing to have some me-time during lunch on some days).
2) Ganged up upon by own manager and his buddy and being left out to dry. 
3) Silo mentality within the company, which makes it hard to get things done. In addition, the industry is a very complicated one which makes things harder to pick up initially.

Why did I list those as pros?
The above pointers have actually moulded me into a better person one year later, and made me gain clarity on what I wanted in a job. (Actually found a good role after leaving StarHub, and met a very nurturing manager which was the complete opp of what I had in StarHub. Had lots of good career advice from him and gained more clarity on what makes a good finance professional).  Hence, if I had not left such a toxic environment in StarHub, I would not have ended up in a better place.
cons: 1) Made a few friends who were my peers there, and was very sad to leave them.

job_title: Insight Manager in Clementi New Town,
pros: Free mobile, broadband and TV services. In the know of the latest mobile devices. Very aesthetically pleasing pantry and meeting room spaces. Fairly good work/life balance for most people.
cons:
1. Innovation is absent because management goes on a witch-hunt when projects and campaigns are unsuccessful, which is often the case 
2. Boot-licking is critical part of getting noticed and some chance of career advancement
3. IT team does not take walk in and all systems request are queued and may take up to a year to implement, if you are lucky
4. Annual increment amounts are a laugh
5. Availability of concessionary staff parking is balloted, unless you are AVP level and above 
6. HR staff are clueless about the different roles that exist within the organization. They only do recruitment and facilitate staff exit interviews and are absent most other times. 
7. The company enforces a "happy" culture
8. Teamwork is part of the company's values which is ironic given the toxic inter-department rivalry

pros:
- The company place great importance on giving good work life balance to employees
- Family friendly working environment
cons:
- People are largely resistant to changes
- Weak internal development teams that can't support digital transformation
- Good performers are often placed together with mediocre ones in performance appraisal for the sake of being fair to everyone which make no sense
- No effort to make to retain good employees 
- Management not up to date on latest development of the market
- Management only prefer to have Yes-man who just listen to them

review_title: Unless you're a natural problem solver, you won't like it here.
pros: I've managed to meet great new friends, learning more on values based on decisiveness, respect & also to be firm to customers and myself. I managed to learn more on how telcos works as well.
cons:
The work-life balance in Starhub is horrendous. Sometimes if the queue gets jammed up, you might not even have the chance to go out and eat peacefully. There will be other staffs that will be calling you and ask you about how to deal with customers. 

Due to the daily stress given from both Starhub and its customers, I found myself sick often and lacking of sleep. I even fainted in the bathroom! With 80+ customers that are always telling you how horrible Starhub is and how unhappy they are, you'll break down sooner or later. Working in the customer service will guarantee you that you'll have to work long hours due to the horrible closing procedures also. 

Perhaps because I'm just not right for this job. It tore me apart.

review_title: Fun working experience whilst waiting for university.
pros:
I worked with a team that made work fun and the fact that my team leader was patient with all of us created a positive working environment for the whole team. Team was always positive, caring and also enjoyed each others company. 
Trainers were great and the classes really taught me some valuable lessons.
cons:
The hours were pretty long, sometimes felt like you worked alot more than what the paycheck yields. 
Half of the customers were pretty angry when you picked up the phone, having the ability to think on your feet allows you to control the situation much better but if you don't, the customer will walk all over you and you have no say.

pros:
The colleagues are nice and friendly.The retail shops has a very fun and casual  Always there to answer your queries. Perhaps because I was a part-timer they were generally more forgiving and patient to teach me. 
Do not need to know as much nor hold as much responsibilities as senior staff or permanent staff.
cons:
Work can be mundane and you need to remain alert at all times. It's a two years mobile contract you are handling! The (poor/disturbing) attitudes of customers (It's sales/customer service what do you expect). But, take it in a positive light, its a form of growth!
Retail hours.(so, ya) Irregular working hours. expect different shifts every week and working on weekends

review_title: Good for maintaining status quo in career growth
pros: Conducive environment to work in, telco services benefits, healthy lifestyle and flexible working (less micro-management, supervisor dependent), many internal career changing opportunities, good for those with families, internal learning courses.
cons: Takes a long time to get promoted if you are average performing or not favored by your higher ups. There is no structured plan for promotion but more dependent on the Personal Score Card. Favoritism/Influence is still a key enabler for better remuneration/bonus and other career upgrade options. Internal transfer may not equate to any increase in remuneration.

review_title: An opportunity to be exposed to various aspects of the business
pros:
I had the opportunity to learn the different business models for TV, online and mobile services.  StarHub was the early leader in offering products across 3 platforms.  

There was some room for creativity in the early days when content business was evolving.
cons: Disconnect in terms of strategy and how they wish to position themselves as consumer service. Served over 6 years with the company and was only promoted once.  Promotion recommendations was submitted several times but was rejected. Some senior management believe that one must work in the same role for at least 5 years before promotion would be considered despite reaching key achievements set by the team leader.  There were other people in the same dept were also overlooked for promotions.

pros: Staff perks very good. A lot of deals and hr welfare stuff.
cons:
- Hire a lot of VPs but when junior staff leave, no one replace them. then those who stay on hv to take up their jobs. so you one person have to take like 3 jobs - your one + 2 more and they will keep adding. no one will review your workload, just keep adding only

- Join here as exec must do a lot of admin job then no room to learn and climb because you will be tie down by the admin chores. but your boss will tell you that this is all part of learning. don't want do then give you all the admin stuff. 

- Wayang management who likes to put on show 

- Poor staff medical & dental benefit. Combine tgt 1 yr less than $400

review_title: Selfish, do your own business culture
pros: Very comfortable office space with big desks, good facilities like gym, spacious pantries, food court, etc. Office is near MRT station and bus stop, quite accessible.
cons: Depending on the team/department that you work at, some colleagues are not helpful at all and keep everything to themselves, do not like to share knowledge, do your own business kind of attitude. Afraid you might snatch their rice bowls away. Not friendly for newbies and difficult to pick up knowledge. Some bosses are bias and favor some senior staff to perform. Junior staff can only be the supporting role and never the main role for performance.

review_title: LOB Leader need training to learn how to lead with patience
pros: so far kind of enjoy to work with the client in StarHub but not with
cons:
The leader who always trying to find fault to blame and take the staff credit.
They just wan the staff to worship them.
LOB leader no patience to listen to staff, do not accept any feedback from the staff. They like to threaten the non local staff by the fear them of losing job.
Selfish LOB leader who never give opportunities to learn and force you to follow what they ask to do; when thing not right blame you by not voice it out.
Bad mouth the staff by cursing the staff will never succeed without them

review_title: Company with most staff turnover ever?
pros: Remuneration perhaps. Staff plan on mobile and broadband
cons:
Management constantly requesting for employees to achieve and overdeliver without looking to resolve key challenges such as

 1. outdated systems (we have systems which nobody know how to operate on)
2. absence of proper work process, absence of structure on knowledge management/transfer. Lack of operational efficiency and unrealistic targets from management has led to  extremely high staff turnover, vicious cycle
3. Uncooperative culture. Teams work on silo and unwilling to collaborate. 
4. Poor work life balance. Not a factor being respected by management and leaders at all. Staff are still pressured heavily to reply to request and mails while on medical leave. A clear lack of empathy
5. Severe lack of manpower and resources at operational level to drive projects and keep up with unrealistic KPIs. Management / leadership team on the contrary keeps expanding  with noticeable influx of expatriates filling up leadership roles

review_title: Big NONO to joining Sales. Planning to leave.
pros: Friendly environment, people are approachable & keen to teach.
cons:
- Messy account segregation. Management didn't spend enough effort in expanding current network / mobile coverage business but recruited many channel partners to "snatch" accounts amongst core AM in StarHub, not forgetting their competitors includes M1 and also big player, SingTel.

- Sales not recognised for renewal orders and upgrades (except nett new) but penalised for not maintaining existing revenue. Total contract value only recognised by half the amount but target and commission remains the same.

- If sales target is not achieved for 3 months, employee will be forced to comply with their newly implemented scheme call (PIP), given 2 months notice to perform. Otherwise, company will ask you to leave.

- Commission forfeited if sales person leave the organisation.

pros: My job was a customer service consultant. Being at the frontline where you are the first person customers come into contact with, you have to be aware of the company's products and basic troubleshooting. Before I started out, I have absolutely no knowledge about mobile and cable service products. The guidance from my mentor made me grasp what was needed for me to start the job proper in just one week. Colleagues are all friendly and warm welcoming towards new staff, hence I had no problem adjusting to the culture there.
cons: Like any other customer service line, we often receive negative comments and sometimes even scoldings from the customers. The long hours of standing also makes the job a little more labor-intensive than other jobs.

review_title: Vacation Job? Yes.  Career Advancement? No.
pros: it will be a great vacation job during semester break in university when you have no intention of staying long or building a career
cons: it is filled with people of lower middle class culture, loads of vulgarities and last minute decisions. ever changing escalations and procedure and a norm with most of the department we get to work with

pros: Generally friendly environment, working level staff are helpful and kind
cons: Poor career opportunities and human resource management. Lack of clarity on management direction. Disconnect between management and working level - new management has high demands however doesn’t seem to understand the amount the working level has to go through to deliver.

pros:
You can get-by practically just doing your own stuff.
You can simply live on your basic pay and heck-care if that is what you want.
cons:
- Not a place for go-getters or high-achievers
- Management do not invest enough in staff training and developments.
- Top heavy company with no replacements for ground staff who left.
- Serious lack of effort in retaining talents hence, no knowledge hand over to newer recruits, resulting in high turnovers.
- VPs and C-suite members are constantly living in their own bubble or pedestal high up.

pros: Working level staff are united and sincere to help each other to get things done.
cons:
- Many unproductive meetings during work hours which cause working level have to work after office hours.
- Different dept have different agenda, more to meet their KPI than for the benefit of the business as a whole.
- Management does not understand the system limitation which requires a lot of manual intervention from the working level.
- Many talkers and very little doers
- Promotion is based on favouritism and not based on merit.
- Not much career opportunity. if you are good at what you are doing they will tell you all the nonsense reason  to keep you at you current position as they are lazy to train newbies .
- Expects you to work during MC and AL
- Fickle minded management

pros: Lots of exposures to young elements like creativity, new ways of doing things and an understanding of how an integrated system such as Cable TV, Broadband and Telecommunications can really work together.
cons: An ever changing industry growing at a pace which changes takes place at an unimaginable pace.  Management may not be doing what they should be doing, resulting rapid turnovers of staffs every month.
